memberdef.name: ngram_model_set_funcs
memberdef.initializer: = { ngram_model_set_free, ngram_model_set_apply_weights, ngram_model_set_score, ngram_model_set_raw_score, ngram_model_set_add_ug, ngram_model_set_flush }

memberdef.argsstring: (cmd_ln_t *config, ngram_model_t **models, char **names, const float32 *weights, int32 n_models)
memberdef.name: ngram_model_set_init

briefdescription.para: Create a set of language models sharing a common space of word IDs.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a meta-language model which groups together a set of language models, synchronizing word IDs between them. To use this language model, you can either select a submodel to use exclusively using ngram_model_set_select(), or interpolate between scores from all models. To do the latter, you can either pass a non-NULL value of the weights parameter, or re-activate interpolation later on by calling ngram_model_set_interp().

In order to make this efficient, there are some restrictions on the models that can be grouped together. The most important (and currently the only) one is that they must all share the same log-math parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Any configuration parameters to be shared between models.
Array of pointers to previously created language models.
Array of strings to use as unique identifiers for LMs.
Array of weights to use in interpolating LMs, or NULL for no interpolation.
Number of elements in the arrays passed to this function.

briefdescription.para: Read a set of language models from a control file.

detaileddescription.para: This file creates a language model set from a "control file" of the type used in Sphinx-II and Sphinx-III. File format (optional stuff is indicated by enclosing in []):

para.preformatted: [{ LMClassFileName LMClassFilename ... }] TrigramLMFileName LMName [{ LMClassName LMClassName ... }] TrigramLMFileName LMName [{ LMClassName LMClassName ... }] ... (There should be whitespace around the { and } delimiters.)

detaileddescription.para: This is an extension of the older format that had only TrigramLMFilenName and LMName pairs. The new format allows a set of LMClass files to be read in and referred to by the trigram LMs.

parameterdescription.para: Path to the language model control file.

Log-math parameters to use for probability calculations. Ownership of this object is assumed by the newly created ngram_model_t, and you should not attempt to free it manually. If you wish to reuse it elsewhere, you must retain it with logmath_retain().

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of language models in a set.
Begin iterating over language models in a set.

simplesect.para: iterator pointing to the first language model, or NULL if no models remain.

briefdescription.para: Move to the next language model in a set.

simplesect.para: iterator pointing to the next language model, or NULL if no models remain.

briefdescription.para: Finish iteration over a langauge model set.
Get language model and associated name from an iterator.

parameterdescription.para: Output: string name associated with this language model.

simplesect.para: Language model pointed to by this iterator.

briefdescription.para: Look up a language model by name from a set.

simplesect.para: language model corresponding to name, or NULL if no language model by that name exists.

briefdescription.para: Select a single language model from a set for scoring.

simplesect.para: the newly selected language model, or NULL if no language model by that name exists.

briefdescription.para: Get the current language model name, if any.
Query the word-ID mapping for the current language model.

simplesect.para: the local word ID in the current language model, or NGRAM_INVALID_WID if set_wid is invalid or interpolation is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Test whether a word ID corresponds to a known word in the current state of the language model set.

simplesect.para: If there is a current language model, returns non-zero if set_wid corresponds to a known word in that language model. Otherwise, returns non-zero if set_wid corresponds to a known word in any language model.

briefdescription.para: Set interpolation weights for a set and enables interpolation.

detaileddescription.para: If weights is NULL, any previously initialized set of weights will be used. If no weights were specified to ngram_model_set_init(), then a uniform distribution will be used.

memberdef.argsstring: (ngram_model_t *base, ngram_model_t *model, const char *name, float32 weight, int reuse_widmap)
memberdef.name: ngram_model_set_add

briefdescription.para: Add a language model to a set.

parameterdescription.para: The language model set to add to.
The name to associate with this model.
Interpolation weight for this model, relative to the uniform distribution. 1.0 is a safe value.
Reuse the existing word-ID mapping in set. Any new words present in model will not be added to the word-ID mapping in this case.

briefdescription.para: Remove a language model from a set.

parameterdescription.para: The language model set to remove from.
The name associated with the model to remove.
Reuse the existing word-ID mapping in set.

briefdescription.para: Set the word-to-ID mapping for this model set.

memberdef.argsstring: (ngram_model_t *base, float32 lw, float32 wip, float32 uw)

memberdef.argsstring: (ngram_model_t *base, int32 wid, int32 *history, int32 n_hist, int32 *n_used)
memberdef.name: ngram_model_set_score
